XKRT
XKRT is a low-level tasking runtime system.

37 # ifndef __LOGGER_CL_H__
38 # define __LOGGER_CL_H__
39 
40 # include <xkrt/logger/logger.h>
41 # include <CL/cl.h>
42 
43 static const char *
44 cl_error_to_str(const int & r)
45 {
46  switch (r)
47  {
48  case CL_SUCCESS: return "CL_SUCCESS";
49  case CL_DEVICE_NOT_FOUND: return "CL_DEVICE_NOT_FOUND";
50  case CL_DEVICE_NOT_AVAILABLE: return "CL_DEVICE_NOT_AVAILABLE";
51  case CL_COMPILER_NOT_AVAILABLE: return "CL_COMPILER_NOT_AVAILABLE";
52  case CL_MEM_OBJECT_ALLOCATION_FAILURE: return "CL_MEM_OBJECT_ALLOCATION_FAILURE";
53  case CL_OUT_OF_RESOURCES: return "CL_OUT_OF_RESOURCES";
54  case CL_OUT_OF_HOST_MEMORY: return "CL_OUT_OF_HOST_MEMORY";
55  case CL_PROFILING_INFO_NOT_AVAILABLE: return "CL_PROFILING_INFO_NOT_AVAILABLE";
56  case CL_MEM_COPY_OVERLAP: return "CL_MEM_COPY_OVERLAP";
57  case CL_IMAGE_FORMAT_MISMATCH: return "CL_IMAGE_FORMAT_MISMATCH";
58  case CL_IMAGE_FORMAT_NOT_SUPPORTED: return "CL_IMAGE_FORMAT_NOT_SUPPORTED";
59  case CL_BUILD_PROGRAM_FAILURE: return "CL_BUILD_PROGRAM_FAILURE";
60  case CL_MAP_FAILURE: return "CL_MAP_FAILURE";
61  case CL_MISALIGNED_SUB_BUFFER_OFFSET: return "CL_MISALIGNED_SUB_BUFFER_OFFSET";
62  case CL_EXEC_STATUS_ERROR_FOR_EVENTS_IN_WAIT_LIST: return "CL_EXEC_STATUS_ERROR_FOR_EVENTS_IN_WAIT_LIST";
63  case CL_COMPILE_PROGRAM_FAILURE: return "CL_COMPILE_PROGRAM_FAILURE";
64  case CL_LINKER_NOT_AVAILABLE: return "CL_LINKER_NOT_AVAILABLE";
65  case CL_LINK_PROGRAM_FAILURE: return "CL_LINK_PROGRAM_FAILURE";
66  case CL_DEVICE_PARTITION_FAILED: return "CL_DEVICE_PARTITION_FAILED";
67  case CL_KERNEL_ARG_INFO_NOT_AVAILABLE: return "CL_KERNEL_ARG_INFO_NOT_AVAILABLE";
68  case CL_INVALID_VALUE: return "CL_INVALID_VALUE";
69  case CL_INVALID_DEVICE_TYPE: return "CL_INVALID_DEVICE_TYPE";
70  case CL_INVALID_PLATFORM: return "CL_INVALID_PLATFORM";
71  case CL_INVALID_DEVICE: return "CL_INVALID_DEVICE";
72  case CL_INVALID_CONTEXT: return "CL_INVALID_CONTEXT";
73  case CL_INVALID_QUEUE_PROPERTIES: return "CL_INVALID_QUEUE_PROPERTIES";
74  case CL_INVALID_COMMAND_QUEUE: return "CL_INVALID_COMMAND_QUEUE";
75  case CL_INVALID_HOST_PTR: return "CL_INVALID_HOST_PTR";
76  case CL_INVALID_MEM_OBJECT: return "CL_INVALID_MEM_OBJECT";
77  case CL_INVALID_IMAGE_FORMAT_DESCRIPTOR: return "CL_INVALID_IMAGE_FORMAT_DESCRIPTOR";
78  case CL_INVALID_IMAGE_SIZE: return "CL_INVALID_IMAGE_SIZE";
79  case CL_INVALID_SAMPLER: return "CL_INVALID_SAMPLER";
80  case CL_INVALID_BINARY: return "CL_INVALID_BINARY";
81  case CL_INVALID_BUILD_OPTIONS: return "CL_INVALID_BUILD_OPTIONS";
82  case CL_INVALID_PROGRAM: return "CL_INVALID_PROGRAM";
83  case CL_INVALID_PROGRAM_EXECUTABLE: return "CL_INVALID_PROGRAM_EXECUTABLE";
84  case CL_INVALID_KERNEL_NAME: return "CL_INVALID_KERNEL_NAME";
85  case CL_INVALID_KERNEL_DEFINITION: return "CL_INVALID_KERNEL_DEFINITION";
86  case CL_INVALID_KERNEL: return "CL_INVALID_KERNEL";
87  case CL_INVALID_ARG_INDEX: return "CL_INVALID_ARG_INDEX";
88  case CL_INVALID_ARG_VALUE: return "CL_INVALID_ARG_VALUE";
89  case CL_INVALID_ARG_SIZE: return "CL_INVALID_ARG_SIZE";
90  case CL_INVALID_KERNEL_ARGS: return "CL_INVALID_KERNEL_ARGS";
91  case CL_INVALID_WORK_DIMENSION: return "CL_INVALID_WORK_DIMENSION";
92  case CL_INVALID_WORK_GROUP_SIZE: return "CL_INVALID_WORK_GROUP_SIZE";
93  case CL_INVALID_WORK_ITEM_SIZE: return "CL_INVALID_WORK_ITEM_SIZE";
94  case CL_INVALID_GLOBAL_OFFSET: return "CL_INVALID_GLOBAL_OFFSET";
95  case CL_INVALID_EVENT_WAIT_LIST: return "CL_INVALID_EVENT_WAIT_LIST";
96  case CL_INVALID_EVENT: return "CL_INVALID_EVENT";
97  case CL_INVALID_OPERATION: return "CL_INVALID_OPERATION";
98  case CL_INVALID_GL_OBJECT: return "CL_INVALID_GL_OBJECT";
99  case CL_INVALID_BUFFER_SIZE: return "CL_INVALID_BUFFER_SIZE";
100  case CL_INVALID_MIP_LEVEL: return "CL_INVALID_MIP_LEVEL";
101  case CL_INVALID_GLOBAL_WORK_SIZE: return "CL_INVALID_GLOBAL_WORK_SIZE";
102  case CL_INVALID_PROPERTY: return "CL_INVALID_PROPERTY";
103  case CL_INVALID_IMAGE_DESCRIPTOR: return "CL_INVALID_IMAGE_DESCRIPTOR";
104  case CL_INVALID_COMPILER_OPTIONS: return "CL_INVALID_COMPILER_OPTIONS";
105  case CL_INVALID_LINKER_OPTIONS: return "CL_INVALID_LINKER_OPTIONS";
106  case CL_INVALID_DEVICE_PARTITION_COUNT: return "CL_INVALID_DEVICE_PARTITION_COUNT";
107  case CL_INVALID_PIPE_SIZE: return "CL_INVALID_PIPE_SIZE";
108  case CL_INVALID_DEVICE_QUEUE: return "CL_INVALID_DEVICE_QUEUE";
109  case CL_INVALID_SPEC_ID: return "CL_INVALID_SPEC_ID";
110  case CL_MAX_SIZE_RESTRICTION_EXCEEDED: return "CL_MAX_SIZE_RESTRICTION_EXCEEDED";
111  default: return "UNKNOWN_ERROR";
112  }
113 }
114 
115 # define CL_SAFE_CALL(X) \
116  do { \
117  int r = X; \
118  if (r != CL_SUCCESS) \
119  LOGGER_FATAL("`%s` failed with err=%s (%d)", #X, cl_error_to_str(r), r); \
120  } while (0)
121 
122 # endif
